alert.note: Alert for Alger; Delta; Dickinson; Marquette; Menominee; Northern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:21PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Dickinson, northern Delta, northern Menominee, southeastern Marquette, west central Schoolcraft and Alger Counties through 945 PM EDT/845 PM CDT/... At 921 PM EDT/821 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Deerton to 7 miles northwest of Trenary to Kingsford. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Deerton around 925 PM EDT. Trenary and U.S. 41 between Trenary and Rapid River around 930 PM EDT. Au Train around 935 PM EDT. Grand Island around 940 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hermansville, Munising, Miners Castle and Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT/1100 PM CDT/ for north central Upper and south central Upper Michigan.

area.areaDesc: Alger; Delta; Dickinson; Marquette; Menominee; Northern Schoolcraft
